variables.name: interest
variables.value: I'm interested in helping automate business tasks using software such as Make.com and Go High Level. I want to make sure this is the main focus, and not just a small piece of the job. I'm only interested in jobs that have a score of over 0/5

variables.name: score
variables.value:
I'm looking for a job that pays a fixed rate, is at least $50 USD or more, and that it is a remote job. scoring is out of 5 and here's how points are awarded:
-2 points if it's super related to Make.com, or 1 point if it's somewhat related to Make.com
-1 point if it's over $50 USD/hour
-1 point if it's a remote job
-1 point if it's fixed rate

parameters.name: handleErrors
parameters.label: Evaluate all states as errors (except for 2xx and 3xx )

messages.content: You're a helpful marketing assistant that is great finding the correct details on Upwork job listings

Please analyze this page {{stripHTML(13.data)}}, and tell me the following information:
- payment type
- duration
- experience_level
- salary
- location
- project_type
- score
 
Here's my guideline for scoring a job properly for me:
{{6.score}}

The output must be JSON, structure like this:
{
"payment_type": "string",
"duration": "string",
""experience_level": "string",
"salary": "string",
"location": "string",
"project_type": "string",
"score": "number"
}

select.label: Create a Chat Completion (GPT and o1 models)

messages.content:
You're applying on Upwork.com for this job:
{{3.title}}

I'm an expert in {{6.expert}}, and want to apply for this job. Please create a compelling response as to why I would be the best candidate for the role. Here's the job description:
{{stripHTML(13.data)}}.

Make sure to have a clear intro, provide a link to the portfolio, answer any questions the client has, thank them for their time and then sign off. 

Only answer questions if they are asked. Otherwise don't create questions and answer them.

Please start by confidently assuring the poster of the job that I can help with the position, while referencing the job title here:
{{3.title}}

Please provide this portfolio link to view:{{6.portfolio}}


If and only if the job posting has questions, please answer these questions. Here's a basic question bank:
Q: When can you start?
A: I can start immediately.
##
Q: How many hours per week can you put in?
A: I can work 40 hours per week.
##
Q: Are you looking for short-term or long-term work?
A: I'm open to both short and long term work, depending on what's available. Usually, most companies like to start on a freelance/part time basis and then monitor performance and take it from there. Let me know what works best for you!
##
Q: How do you define success?
A: Meeting my own expectations. Unfortunately, they're very high (much higher than other people's expectations ony me). As an analogy, I like to get 30 hours of work done in a 24 hour day - always pushing the boundaries of whats possible and delivering excellent in all the little details.
##
Q: Why should I hire you over someone else?
A: I've ran my own business for 10 years, doing exactly what you're looking to do. I've genearte $[x] in that time, and had [y] and [z] achievements.
##
Q: Are you working as an individual, team or part of an agency?
A: I'm working as ana individual freelancer.
##
Q: As mentioned previously, please provide some examples of past work you've done, SEO or otherwise.
A: Here's my portfolio of work!:
{{6.portfolio}}
##

Thank them for their time.

Sign off by with: Best,
Karim

Following these formatting requirements:
1. Do not use any custom variables such as [Name], or [Client's Name]. 
2.Do not include any HTML or Markdown, make sure it's plain text
3. Make sure to not include any additional text other than the message. Do not include an intro or conclusion in the response that isn't the Freelancer.com application itself.
4. Don't try to use markdown language to do things like bolding text such as **changing text**. Make sure it's plain text
5. For any lists, make sure to structure them as a numbered listed, with a bracket, such as 1) or 2) or 3)
6. Do not include a subject line
